intro: Petesia ternifolia, commonly known as the three-leaf petesia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, each consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. Petesia ternifolia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
